page.title: 13 HOME MEADOWS NURSERY
page.content: Home Meadows Nursery is situated on the south facing slopes of the River Fynn, which is a tributary of the River Deben. The Nursery has eight long greenhouses in which grow different varieties of flowers. The greenhouses are heated in winter by a coal furnace, which is automatically controlled by a computer, to keep the temperature at 50 degrees Celsius. The insulation is thermal bubble polythene against the glass. They have 30,000 Chrysanthemums plants all at different stages of growth. Autumn is the best time of year to see them when they are ready for sale. An unusual flower grown here is the Icelandic Poppy in hues of white,orange and yellow. It has won many prizes at the Chelsea Flower Show.
